channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Israel extends order allowing closure of foreign broadcasters
item.description: A bill passed by parliament expands temporary powers introduced during the Gaza war to shutter outlets seen as a security threat.

item.title: UN experts urge Iran to stop execution of woman activist
item.description: Zahra Tabari, 67, was sentenced to death after a trial that lasted less than 10 minutes, her family says.

item.title: NGOs fear Israel registration rules risk collapse of Gaza aid operations
item.description: International organisations not registered by 31 December face closure in Israel, but the Israeli government says aid delivery will not be affected.

item.title: Baby followed by BBC back in Gaza hospital after treatment abroad
item.description: The BBC revisits one-year-old Siwar Ashour who was temporarily evacuated to Jordan for medical treatment during the Gaza war.

item.title: Israel approves 19 new settlements in occupied West Bank
item.description: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said the move was about blocking the establishment of a Palestinian state.

item.title: How Israel's grassroots hostage families group became a powerful international force
item.description: With just one hostage left in Gaza, members of the forum reflect on its influence in Israel and abroad.

item.title: Rights groups condemn new record number of executions in Saudi Arabia
item.description: At least 347 people have now been put to death this year, according to the UK-based campaign group Reprieve.

item.title: US carries out 'massive' strike against IS in Syria
item.description: The US says it struck dozens of targets across Syria in response to last week's deadly Islamic State attack on US forces there.

item.title: Palestinians tell BBC they were sexually abused in Israeli prisons
item.description: Two men say they experienced the kind of abuse highlighted in recent reports on Israel's treatment of prisoners, which Israel denies.

item.title: UN-backed experts say Gaza food supplies improving but 100,000 still in 'catastrophic conditions'
item.description: Israel says the report "doesn't reflect the reality" and ignores the volume of aid entering the Gaza Strip.

item.title: Heavy rains worsen conditions for displaced Gazans, UN warns
item.description: Gaza's health ministry says one baby has died from hypothermia and 11 other people have died in building collapses over the past week.

item.title: Trump expands US travel ban to Syria and Palestinian passport holders
item.description: The US will restrict entry of people from Burkina Faso, Mali, Niger, South Sudan and Syria as well as holders of Palestinian Authority passports.

item.title: Iranian Nobel laureate taken to hospital after 'violent arrest', family says
item.description: Narges Mohammadi told her family in a phone call that she was beaten on the head and neck by plainclothes agents in Mashhad last week.

item.title: Three Americans killed by IS gunman in Syria, US military says
item.description: Two US soldiers and a civilian interpreter were killed in the attack, according to the US Central Command.

item.title: Israel targets senior Hamas official in deadly Gaza strike
item.description: The strike killed Raed Saad, a senior commander in Hamas' Qassam Brigades, the Israeli military said.

item.title: Trump's Gaza peace plan struggles to progress as Israel and Hamas face tough choices
item.description: Getting both sides to move onto the second stage is a huge challenge for Washington, as Gazans continue to suffer the longer it takes.

item.title: Jeremy Bowen: Syria feels lighter without the Assads' crushing weight - but now there are new problems
item.description: One year into his rule Syria's leader has won over Trump and much of the West, but at home people know his weaknesses.

item.title: 'Like first aid for manuscripts': Recovery work begins at Gaza's war-damaged heritage sites
item.description: Palestinians are clearing rubble from archaeological sites, but restoration is hampered by Israeli restrictions on building materials.

item.title: Crisis looms in Israel over ultra-Orthodox conscription bill
item.description: Lawmakers are considering a draft bill to end the exemption granted to ultra-Orthodox men enrolled in full-time religious study.

item.title: Why I spend hours painstakingly repairing banknotes
item.description: Fixing cash is a thriving new business in Gaza after Israel stopped transfers of banknotes and banks were destroyed and looted.

item.title: Year after ceasefire, peace eludes south Lebanon as Israeli strikes continue
item.description: A year on from a ceasefire in Lebanon, Israel is continuing attacks on what it says are Hezbollah's efforts to recover from their war.

item.title: Gaza food kitchens still missing essential products despite ceasefire
item.description: Israel is allowing more food into Gaza, but aid workers say vital ingredients needed to improve people's diets are still missing.

item.title: Anti-Hamas armed groups seek future role under Gaza peace plan
item.description: Several groups - some of them backed by Israel - are ranged against Hamas in Gaza, with complex and overlapping ties.

item.title: Palestinians forced from West Bank refugee camps left in limbo as Israeli demolitions go on
item.description: A Human Rights Watch report claims Israel’s forcible displacement of residents from three refugee camps violates international humanitarian law.

item.title: Shelters plea for Gazans as winter rains raise fears of more disease and death
item.description: Displaced Palestinians face life-threatening conditions, as aid agencies appeal for more shelters to be allowed in.

item.title: Record settler attacks in West Bank opening up rifts within Israel
item.description: More than 260 settler attacks in October resulted in Palestinians being injured or having property damaged, according to the UN.

item.title: Israel has destroyed more than 1,500 buildings in Gaza since ceasefire
item.description: Entire neighbourhoods controlled by Israel have been levelled in less than a month, the images show.

item.title: Ros Atkins on… The alleged links between the UAE and Sudan's civil war
item.description: BBC Analysis Editor Ros Atkins examines allegations of links between the UAE and Sudan’s RSF in the civil war, as international efforts continue to seek an end to the fighting.

item.title: Watch: Syrians share their thoughts one year on from the fall of Assad
item.description: The BBC's Middle East correspondent Hugo Bachega speaks to Syrians about how life has changed since the revolution.

item.title: Bethlehem Christmas tree illuminated for first time since Gaza war began
item.description: Hundreds gathered in Manger Square to bask in the festivities that included music, dancing and Santas bearing sweet treats.

item.title: 'The emotions that I kept locked, came out when I left Gaza'
item.description: Hanya Aljamal, a teacher turned aid worker from Gaza, talks about the alienation she feels after being permitted to move to London to study last month.

item.title: Popemobile becomes a mobile health clinic for Gaza children
item.description: The vehicle had transported the late Pope Francis on a visit to Bethlehem in 2014.

item.title: BBC visits US-led Gaza ceasefire monitoring centre in Israel
item.description: Soldiers from more than 20 countries, diplomats and aid workers are based at the Civil-Military Coordination Centre (CMCC).

item.title: Trump says Saudi crown prince 'knew nothing' about Jamal Khashoggi's murder
item.description: The claim contradicts a 2021 US intelligence report, which said the de facto leader "approved an operation" to "capture or kill" the journalist.
